item.title: q add a quote by E. R. Eddison
item.description: "A thin ungracious drink is the well-spring, a drink for queasy-stomached skipjacks: for sand-levericks, not for men. And like it is the dayspring: an ungrateful sapless hour, an hour for stab-i'-the-backs and cold-blooded betrayers. Ah, give me wine, and noon-day vices, and brazen-browed iniquities." -- E. R. Eddison

item.title: q add a quote by Seamus Heaney
item.description: "If self is a location, so is love: Bearings taken, markings, cardinal points, Options, obstinacies, dug heels, and distance, Here and there and now and then, a stance." -- Seamus Heaney

item.title: q add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "The glacier knocks in the cupboard, The desert sighs in the bed, And the crack in the teacup opens A lane to the land of the dead." -- W.H. Auden
